summary: Wrap GRPC::CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED errors in an SDK Timeout exception for Update operations so users only need to catch one predictable exception type.
userImpact: Users must handle multiple GRPC exception types instead of a single SDK timeout exception, making error handling more complex and error-prone.
rootCause: GRPC errors (CANCELED, DEADLINE_EXCEEDED) are not wrapped in SDK-level exceptions for Update operations.
proposedFix: Wrap GRPC::CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED in an SDK Timeout exception for Update operations, similar to implementation in other SDKs.
resolutionDetails: Implemented wrapping of GRPC errors in SDK Timeout exception based on cross-SDK implementation details.
keyQuote: So that users only have to catch one predictable exception
